Package stochasticSimulation

Class Individual

  • java.lang.Object
    • stochasticSimulation.Individual

  • public class Individual
extends java.lang.Object
    The Individual class that defines the individuals created and evolved during a stochastic simulation execution. Individuals are the motor of the simulation, by mutating they achieve a greater comfort, which gives them a greater chance at reproducing and surviving. Because of that, during the runtime of a simulation the population of individuals evolves in such a way that as time goes a larger number of individuals with high comfort proliferates, increasing the chance of finding the optimal solution to a given problem. The implementation of Individual provided assumes that it is used in a problem taking place in a grid.
    Author:
    Manuel Serra

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected double comfort
      The comfort parameter of the individual.
      protected int cost
      The total cost of the individual's path so far.
      protected double deathTime
      The determined time of death of the individual.
      protected int dist
      The distance between the current position of the individual and the goal, not taking obstacles into account.
      protected int id
      The identifier number of an individual object.
      protected int length
      The total length of the individual's path so far, in steps.
      protected java.util.List<Point> path
      the list of points that constitutes the path traversed by the individual so far.
      protected Population pop
      The population where the individual belongs.
      protected Point position
      the current position of the individual within the grid.
      protected boolean reachedGoal
      A boolean that tells whether the final position has been reached (true) or not (false).
      protected boolean[][] visited
      A boolean table that keeps track of the visited positions (true).

    • Field Detail

      • id

        protected int id
        The identifier number of an individual object. Unique within a Population.

        protected double comfort
        The comfort parameter of the individual.

      • deathTime

        protected double deathTime
        The determined time of death of the individual. Defined with a setter.

        A boolean table that keeps track of the visited positions (true).

      • reachedGoal

        protected boolean reachedGoal
        A boolean that tells whether the final position has been reached (true) or not (false). Initialized with a setter.

        The total cost of the individual's path so far.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Individual

        Individual​(Point pos,
           Population pop)
        Constructor for an Individual. The id is set according to the next ID of the population
        Parameters:
        pos - is the initial position of the individual in the grid.
        pop - is the population where the individual belongs.

    • Method Detail

      • makeChild

        protected Individual makeChild​()
        This method allows the individual to reproduce. It starts by creating a new instance of Individual, the child. The child always receives the first 90% of the parent's path, and a fraction comfort of the remaining 10% is also given. The child's parameter are updated and the child is added to the same population of the parent.
        Returns:
        The child of the indiviudal.

      • setPosition

        protected void setPosition​(Point pos)
        A setter for the Individual's position.
        Parameters:
        pos - the Point to be set as the individual's new position.

      • update

        protected void update​()
        This method updated the fields of the individual, namely it's visited positions, the path, length, cost, dist and comfort. It also detects whether the path of the individuals has any loops, in which case the loop is removed.

      • updateDist

        protected void updateDist​()
        This method updates the distance of the individual by calculating the distance between it's position and the goal.

      • updatePath

        protected void updatePath​()
        This method updates the path of the individual by adding it's current position to the path.

      • updateLength

        protected void updateLength​()
        This method updates the length of the individual's path by one or by 0 if the path has length 1.

      • updateCost

        protected void updateCost​(Point origin,
                          Point destination)
        This method updates the cost of the individual by adding the cost of a step to the previous cost.
        Parameters:
        origin - the initial point of the step.
        destination - the final point of the step.

      • updateComfort

        protected void updateComfort​()
        This method updates the comfort of an individual according to it's parameters

      • removePathLoop

        protected void removePathLoop​()
        This method removes loops from the path. It must be called in the moment when a loop is detected. It starts by deleting the path from the point of origin of the loop on and then updates the length and cost of the individual.

      • copyPath

        protected java.util.List<Point> copyPath​()
        Makes a complete copy of the individual's path.
        Returns:
        A LinkedList of Points representing the path.

      • getPathFirst

        protected Point getPathFirst​()
        This method retrieves the first point in the Individual's path.
        Returns:
        The first point of the path of the individual.

      • getPathLen

        protected int getPathLen​()
        This method retrieved the size of the path of the individual. It is provided to reduce the need of change in code in case a redefinition of Individual is made with a different data structure for the path.
        Returns:
        An int with the length of the path.

      • newVisitedHist

        protected void newVisitedHist​()
        This method creates a new table of visited with the dimensions of the grid where the individual lives.

      • setVisited

        protected void setVisited​(Point p)
        Setter for the visited table as true.
        Parameters:
        p - the point to be marked as visited.

      • setNotVisited

        protected void setNotVisited​(Point p)
        Setter for the visited table as false.
        Parameters:
        p - the point to be marked as not visited.

      • currPosVisited

        protected boolean currPosVisited​()
        This method tells whether the current position of the Individual has been reached.
        Returns:
        boolean that is set as true if the position has been visited and as false otherwise.

      • getID

        public int getID​()
        Getter for the ID field.
        Returns:
        the ID if the individual.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​()
        Redefinition of the toString() method.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
